instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage. Original problem apple progress bar freezing about a quarter of the way. Resoldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and booted successfully. When turning on a second time board suddenly died and now there is a 0.10 short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and voltage only 1.8V

Nothing is getting hot on the board. Removed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to rule out but still short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

Removed F7040 and F7041 and short is on pin 2 of each.

What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check for short between PPBUS and GPU VCore. If so, RIP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
If you get same 010 on L8930/60, then <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> is burnt.
Supposedly bad solders on pins 20/29, 19/30 of <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, or damaged R/C bootstrap.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
2informaticos was right on. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and short was gone <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> back to 12.60V with just ac adapter.

When trying to power on with battery connected left fan was barely spinning for a few seconds and then died again. Same short is back again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Did you check all I mentioned before???
Even <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> can be bad now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Short gone and board powering up normally but now have a black screen. <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> is soldered properly. Anything else to check before replacing <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> again ? All parts came off donar

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Could be dead GPU; heat it for test.
Do you get USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
GPU was working fine when first arrived since apple logo appeared, just wouldnt fully load OSX.

<SIGNAL>PVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> is 0V. Will update when new <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> arrive

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: You bridged something more than likely which shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and likely killed theGPU. You must replace all fets and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> when something like that happens on the off chance it survives.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Have you confirmed you have image ? I Have the same case , but got mine resolved

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"GPU was working fine when first arrived"
That is not a reason to assume is still better after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> was shorted two times.
You can change required components and pray (a lot) before power it on...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Which specific fets do you need to replace? Replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> but still 0V on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL>. 0.009 short on diode mode. Should GPU be heated next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
200 diode mode on GPU VCORE is to high.
009 is good value I suppose.

Change at same time <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>/31/61.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C8930</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R8960</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8965</CAPACITOR> are all good.
Also be sure to have good traces and solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Made a typo with measurement.

its actually 0.020. Is that a normal value or should all requested parts still be changed out?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Change them, value looks good...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Everything changed and checked.

0V still on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> but 4.75V on <CAPACITOR>C8965</CAPACITOR>

Turns on and chimes but no backlight or image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Is gets enable and correct power on all pins, <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> should generate GPU VCORE.
Maybe knocked off component, broken trace, bad solder.
Re-check all the job.
Post again diode mode on L8930/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8950</RESISTOR> was missing.

with it L8930 0.014  L8960 0.014
